Class GameState

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameState

  • public class GameState
extends java.lang.Object
    The GameState class holds everything about the current state of the game in it. it is possibly easier to envision the GameState class as the player itself, as it holds the current inventory, the players current health and current score.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  GameState.IllegalSaveFormatException 

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) static java.lang.String ADVENTURER_MARKER
      part of file that talks about the Adventurer, like his inventory of his current room.
      (package private) static java.lang.String CURRENT_ROOM_LEADER
      The header below "Adventurer:" in the file that talks about the adventurers current room things below it will contain Room data to be parse through in the Room Class
      (package private) static java.lang.String DEFAULT_SAVE_FILE
      the Default Save file that the Bork will be saved to if something goes wrong in the saving process, or it cannot get its file from the original bork
      (package private) static java.lang.String INVENTORY_LEADER
      The Header in the Adventurer section that contains the player's current Inventory things below it will contain Item data to be parsed through in the Item Class and will be put into the players inventory
      (package private) static java.lang.String SAVE_FILE_EXTENSION
      the extension that will be put at the end of a save file when saved
      (package private) static java.lang.String SAVE_FILE_VERSION
      the version of bork that the sav file has to be in order to be read, must be in format "Bork v #.0 save data" verbatim to be read currently v3.0

      get adventurers current health, probably should make it a sort of fraction for later like "2/5"

      updates the game so that it is its current state

      removes items from player's inventory

      The "Load Game" function of the game.

      sets the adventurer's (player's) current room used in the "loading" a ".sav" file
      (package private) void setHealth(int def)
      sets the adventurers current/starting health
      (package private) void store()
      the default "Save Game" function of bork if something goes wrong with the normal store method, this will store the save data in file called "bork_save.sav" throws IOException if something goes wrong with the reading and writing of files
      (package private) void store(java.lang.String saveName)
      the "Save Game" function of bork, will write the current condition of the game to a ".sav" file named after the ".bork" file used if game was loaded from a ".sav" file, said file will be overwritten.

    • Field Detail

      • ADVENTURER_MARKER

        static java.lang.String ADVENTURER_MARKER
        part of file that talks about the Adventurer, like his inventory of his current room. if absent, file will not load properly and crash the game

      • CURRENT_ROOM_LEADER

        static java.lang.String CURRENT_ROOM_LEADER
        The header below "Adventurer:" in the file that talks about the adventurers current room things below it will contain Room data to be parse through in the Room Class

      • DEFAULT_SAVE_FILE

        static java.lang.String DEFAULT_SAVE_FILE
        the Default Save file that the Bork will be saved to if something goes wrong in the saving process, or it cannot get its file from the original bork

      • INVENTORY_LEADER

        static java.lang.String INVENTORY_LEADER
        The Header in the Adventurer section that contains the player's current Inventory things below it will contain Item data to be parsed through in the Item Class and will be put into the players inventory

      • SAVE_FILE_EXTENSION

        static java.lang.String SAVE_FILE_EXTENSION
        the extension that will be put at the end of a save file when saved

      • SAVE_FILE_VERSION

        static java.lang.String SAVE_FILE_VERSION
        the version of bork that the sav file has to be in order to be read, must be in format "Bork v #.0 save data" verbatim to be read currently v3.0

      • restore

        void restore(java.lang.String filename)
      throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
             GameState.IllegalSaveFormatException,
             Dungeon.IllegalDungeonFormatException
        The "Load Game" function of the game. only called when loading a ".sav" file
        Parameters:
        filename - String that is the filename
        Throws:
        GameState.IllegalSaveFormatException - if save file not compatible
        GameState.IllegalSaveFormatException - if there is no filename Leader after the version indicator
        GameState.IllegalSaveFormatException - if there is an item name that does not exist in the dungeon
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Dungeon.IllegalDungeonFormatException

        sets the adventurers current/starting health
        Parameters:

      • store

        void store()
    throws java.io.IOException
        the default "Save Game" function of bork if something goes wrong with the normal store method, this will store the save data in file called "bork_save.sav" throws IOException if something goes wrong with the reading and writing of files
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • store

        void store(java.lang.String saveName)
    throws java.io.IOException
        the "Save Game" function of bork, will write the current condition of the game to a ".sav" file named after the ".bork" file used if game was loaded from a ".sav" file, said file will be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        saveName - the name of the file used to save the game. named after the bork file used.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if something goes wrong with the reading and writing of files.
